pros: Good fellow working community - College is expanding
cons: Absolutely terrible support from HR and certain supervisors. They hire people who are not qualified for their jobs over people who are highly qualified.

job_title: Assistant Professor, Health Sciences in Emory, VA
pros: 10 month Contract. Small school so you get to know all staff and students. Great location with lots of outdoor and historic activities.
cons: Academic politics still reign. Southwest Virginia is still conservative. Working on diversity and inclusion, but it is still the man's world.

job_title: Vice President, Diversity & Inclusion in Emory, VA
Director of Disability Support Services in Emory, VA
pros: The community here is wonderful and it is a great school. I feel supported.
cons: The benefits are not great. Insurance is expensive and there is virtually no retirement.

review_title: Lawsuits for you! lawsuits for you! Everyone gets to sue!
job_title: Director of Instructional Design & Technology in Abingdon, VA
cons: Employees are treated badly By both HR and the President’s office. They require separation agreements to get any severance pay to keep ex employees from speaking out. . Multiple suits filed and won against them in relation to employment law Budgets are minimal, IT is impossible to work with and they DO NOT reward good performance. In five years I got one raise.
